duck: mammalogy definition: a branch of zoology dealing with mammals.
In zoology, mammalogy is the study of mammals – a class of vertebrates with characteristics such as homeothermic metabolism, fur, four-chambered hearts, and complex nervous systems.

milestones: New rodent discovery leads to new mammal family

wiki.text:
In zoology, 'mammalogy' is the study of mammals – a class of vertebrates with
characteristics such as homeothermic metabolism, fur, four-chambered hearts, and
complex nervous systems. Mammalogy has also been known as "'mastology',"
"'theriology'," and "'therology'."

Mammalogy branches off into other taxonomically-oriented disciplines such as
primatology (study of primates), and cetology (study of cetaceans).
wiki.title: mammalogy
